newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Tyumen insurers raised 470 bln rbls in H1.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Tyumen insurers raised 470 bln rbls in H1.

text.p: Tyumen region's 67 insurance companies collected 470 billion roubles ($87.2 million) in premiums in the first half of 1996 and paid out 384 billion roubles, a representative of the state insurance supervisor said on Tuesday.
Leonid Yanin said 11 branches of ASKO, Russia's biggest private insurance company, accounted for 19 percent of all premiums.
TyuASF, a branch of Rosgosstrakh, Russia's biggest insurer, raised 39.60 billion roubles, or 8.4 percent of premiums, he said.

Gazpromyshlennaya Tyumenskaya Strakhovaya Gruppa collected 14.20 billion roubles and Germes-Polis together with Germes-Polis Ltd, which focuses on property insurance, collected 6.8 percent of all premiums.
